Derivatives must be credited to O Say Can You See, made available non-commercially, and distributed under the same terms. Requests for permission for commercial publication or other use should be emailed to the project team.

div1.p: Being déreious of obtaining further information as to trade conditions in the Kongo Free State, I have the honor to request of your Excellency a reply as early a date as possible to the following questions. It is not intended that the region known as the Lower Kongo is to be included in the point upon which I desire information.

1. Under that conditions would the Kongo Free State permit an American commercial house of financial responsibility to establish itself in the Kalai district, or in any other district now by Concessionary or by the State "energie" for the purpose of buying rubber, ivory and gum and all other products of the soil from the

2. Will the State sell sufficient suitable wealities in the above districts to an American commercial house to permit of the érection of factories and warehouses in order to enable it to carry on a with the nations in the above products? If so under what conditions?

3. If not, in what districts in the territory of the may an American commerical house which has no of land, buy sufficient land and factories and warehouses and trade freely in all produce of the uneluding ivory duvet with the natives and what

4. Will the State allow our American Company to operate steamers on the upper Congo and all its affluents for the transportation of good belonging to third parties and of passengers both white and black? If no what conditions
5. Will it enough land and of or in the vicinity along the navigable waterway for the erectioin of repair shops, docks and for the building of steamers to carry on a regular transport business.
